news_header: Sister Rosita Milesi, a Scalabrini nun, received the Nansen Refugee Award for her 40 years of advocacy for refugees in Brazil.
news_text: Sister Rosita Milesi, aged 79, was awarded the Nansen Refugee Award by the United Nations High Commission for Refugees for her dedication to protecting displaced individuals. A member of the Scalabrini nuns, she has spent 40 years utilizing her skills as a lawyer and social worker to advocate for the rights of refugees and the internally displaced in Brazil. Currently, she serves as the director of the Migration and Human Rights Institute. In her acceptance statement, Milesi expressed her commitment to helping and integrating refugees, stating her readiness to take action despite challenges. The Nansen Refugee Award, established in 1954 and named after humanitarian Fridtjof Nansen, has previously honored notable figures such as Eleanor Roosevelt and Angela Merkel.
